intro: Allophylus amboinensis, commonly known as the Amboina alpine, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in catkins, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Allophylus amboinensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
